subject: Under One Sky
summary: Apabila Nalini hanya mampu mendapatkan sebelanga air untuk hari itu, dia bimbang akan leteran ibu mentuanya. Sedang dia sibuk menyelesaikan masalahnya, tidak ramai yang sedia membantu.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2018

subject: Roads Less Travelled
summary: A couple anticipated the birth of their first child and hoped that they could raise him to be a model citizen. However the father, the sole breadwinner of the family, passed away suddenly. The burden was placed on the young uneducated widow to raise her child alone. Determined to fulfill her husband’s dream, she worked day and night. Her continued absence from home had an adverse effect on her son. He took a deadly path that shattered the mother. She made a bold decision to save her only child.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: The protagonist's thumb was stung by a bee and even after she pulled out the bee stinger, the overwhelming pain caused him to lose sleep. She woke up trying to relieve the pain using various methods like rinsing the thumb under cold running water, applying toothpaste on it, etc. However, the pain did not go away. Out of desperation, she drew the curtains and looked out of the window, pleading to Heaven for help. It was then she realised the beauty of the darkness.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: The protagonist and her nephew witnessed how the exhumers dug out her late mother’s grave to retrieve her disinterred remains for cremation. The jade bangle that had been on Mother’s wrist when she was buried, was still intact and had not lost its shine. The jade bangle rekindled fond memories of Mother.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Bridges
summary: Badang is a poor, young slave who is given superhuman strength that makes him the strongest man in Singapura. When word of his strength gets out, he receives invitations to challenges from the strongest men in the region. Is Badang the strongest of them all?
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2012

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Cerita rakyat Vietnam ini mengisarkan seorang petani yang bijak dan seekor harimau yang bongkak namun mengidamkan kebijaksanaan. Harimau diberi ajaran, lantas mendapat jalur-jalurnya.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: This is a tale that explores human relationships. Raised by a widowed mother, the protagonist struggles to appease his mother and wife.  Things turn ugly and the mother leaves home to fend for herself.  The man discovers the true meaning of the bond between a mother and child after witnessing his son’s birth.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Roads Less Travelled
summary: This is a concise and charming story of a young girl who had a lot of fun listening to and singing her favourite Chinese songs with her group of friends. At a time when compact discs were still rare, the girls relied on the cassette tape to record their futile attempts in imitating established singers. Little would we expect the young amateur singer would one day grow up to pursue a successful career in pop music and showbiz. The road to fame began with a stack of cassette tapes and a trusty cassette recorder.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Cekal-Tekal-Mekar: Karya Sepanjang Zaman
summary: Cekal-Tekal-Mekar: Karya Sepanjang Zaman merupakan sebuah antologi yang mengandungi 20 cerpen dan dua sajak hasil karya penulis tempatan dan dari luar negeri.nKoleksi unik ini diterbitkan untuk meraikan ulangtahun kempen Baca! Singapura anjuran Lembaga Perpustakaan Negara yang ke-10, dengan menyatukan cerpen-cerpen yang pernah diterbitkan dalam antologi-antologi Baca! Singapura yang lepas. Cerpen-cerpen dalam Bahasa Melayu, berserta terjemahan cerpen yang asalnya ditulis dalam Bahasa Inggeris, Mandarin dan Tamil dimuatkan untuk meraikan kepelbagaian bahasa dan budaya kita. Cekal-Tekal-Mekar adalah sebuah antologi yang memperingatkan kita akan kuasa dan daya ketahanan penulisan bermutu – mari bersama-sama meraih ilham dari Karya Sepanjang Zaman.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2014

subject: Roads Less Travelled
summary: The story takes place at a large farm and revolves around feelings of unhappiness of a herd of cows due to the conditions that they were in. They were reared to provide labour within the farm as well as for their meat. While the cows acknowledged that they were basically well-taken care of and had access to their basic necessities of life, they lived in fear that they might be killed any time.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Bridges
summary: Cerpen yang berkisar mengenai kehidupan seharian seorang pemuda bernama Asrul di dalam lif. Setiap babak di dalam lif digambarkan dengan jelas ditambah pula dengan aspek lucu yang cukup menghiburkan.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2012

subject: Transition
summary: Saintis pencipta roket, itulah yang diberitahu En. Shi kepada orang ramai apabila ditanya mengenai kerjayanya di China. Seorang pesara, dia kemudiannya menambah dengan rasa rendah diri, apabila ramai yang mengaguminya. En. Shi telah mempelajari ungkapan itu dari seorang wanita semasa singgah bermalam di Detroit, apabila dia cuba menerangkan kepadanya tentang kerjanya, melukis gambar apabila bahasa Inggerisnya gagal membantu. “Saintis pencipta roket!” Wanita itu berteriak, sambil ketawa dengan kuat.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Penulis terfikirkan masa silam yang diharungi nenek moyang dan ibu bapanya, sedang dia terjumpa dua buah peti kayu yang diwarisi dari nenek moyangnya.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2022

subject: Under One Sky
summary: This short story narrates the reflective and critical undergraduate who ponders over the plight, history and destiny of her people, encountering several historical personalities in the Malay society. Encounter brings the reader to the discursive ideas of the universality of human experiences and the needs of particularity in the Malay society.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Roads Less Travelled
summary: “Ever After” explores the intricacies of love and relationships in a closely-knitted family living a seemingly simple life. Memories, observations and thoughts were interwoven in a teenage girl’s journey to understand her parents’ world, one in which she existed only at the periphery. As she tried to piece together these precious moments, she discovered a surprising truth about herself
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Penduduk Kampung Taman Tiga Warna tergempar melihat kehadiran seekor gajah putih di tengah perkarangan masjid. Semua penduduk kampung cuba menentukan nasib gajah yang penuh misteri.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2016

subject: Transition
summary: Bagi diri Tengku Aman, di Anjung Budiman inilah dia belajar berdikari sekali lagi.  Memanglah sejak kecil dulu dia sudah belajar untuk berdiri kaki sendiri.  Arwah ibunda dan ayahandanya telah mendidiknya untuk berdikari.  Kedua-dua insan yang telah menjadi arwah itu telah berpesan kepadanya.  Malah sebelum mereka menghembus nafas terakhir mereka sempat berwasiat walaupun jarak mereka mati adalah sepuluh tahun.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Love unites two souls from different religions. They wed against their parents’ wishes. Their first child reunites the families. Their happiness is short lived.  The child is diagnosed as mentally challenged. The husband leaves her blaming her for bearing him an abnormal child.  She starts a new life with her child in a neighbourhood. The love of her friends, maid and neighbours allows her son to participate in a sports event and win the race. A moving story that beautifully narrates the plight of single mothers who are forced to raise mentally challenged children in today’s society.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Bridges
summary: “Grasshoppers” is a story about a 12-year-old boy who has no father, and is brought up by his mother, a popiah seller. The young boy learns more about his family’s history from his neighbours and is inspired by the forward jumping grasshopper.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2012

subject: Ties That Bind
summary: The story revolves around two childhood friends, Thanabal and Parthiban who have different aspirations in life, yet bonded because of friendship.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Jack seorang anak kacukan Cina-Amerika. Mainan kesayangannya sewaktu kecil adalah sebuah set haiwan origami yang dibuat ibunya. Semakin hubungan dengan ibunya renggang, ciptaan ibunya juga diketepikan. Suatu hari, mereka muncul kembali dengan sepotong pesanan peninggalan ibunya.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2019

subject: Transition
summary: This house is a part of my life. It is a part of me. I suppose this is the case for everyone. This is the house where my children were brought up.  My last son and daughter were born in this house.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: A folktale from Vietnam about a wise farmer and a boastful Tiger who covets wisdom.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Transition
summary: “... Nisbah perempuan dengan lelaki tahun ini ialah 1:15 berdasarkan ...” Toot! Dengan cepat aku menekan punat merah kawalan jauh (remote control). Itulah yang diulang-ulang di berita. Seolah-olah ingin mengingatkan umur aku yang semakin diragut masa. Aku mengerti aku kini 43 dan belum berumah tangga lagi. Itu pun pelik ke? Aku juga manusia. Aku juga ingin berumah tangga namun siapa yang inginkan aku?
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Bridges
summary: Kisah yang menyayat hati mengenai seorang gadis yang bernama Sakinah, yang cuba melepaskan ibunya dari belenggu kemurungan setelah pemergian ayahnya ke Rahmatullah. Berbekalkan sekuntum sajak dan sebuah lukisan,  untuk si Ibu sebagai penawar.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2012

subject: Transition
summary: Govindan telah meninggal dunia. Dia dan aku bekerja untuk akhbar yang sama. Aku merupakan seorang penyunting. Dia adalah satu-satunya jurukamera di situ. Dia lebih mesra dipanggil “pakar fotografi” oleh kami.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Setelah mengharungi tentangan hebat kerana mengahwini lelaki yang berlainan agama dan bangsa, pencerita ditinggalkan suaminya dan terpaksa membesarkan anaknya yang kurang upaya.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2025

subject: Ties That Bind
summary: What happens when a rebellious child brought up in the West, meets her Asian father in Singapore? That was what Li Wen, a.k.a. Lee found out when her mother passed away in Los Angeles. Brought up in the States since she was eight years old, and with no one to rely on after her stepfather shirked his responsibility of raising her, Lee has no choice but to return to Singapore to seek shelter with her biological father. Claire Tham presents an interesting account of the emotional ties that binds father and daughter as both struggles to adjust to each other’s lifestyle.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Angah berkecil hati kerana merasakan bahawa adat pepatih yang diamalkan oleh orang-orang Negeri Sembilan tidak menyebelahinya. Anak perempuannya pula mendesaknya untuk mengajar cara-cara menyediakan lemang, membuatkan Angah sedar akan pentingnya adat tradisi dan talian kekeluargaan.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2014

subject: Roads Less Travelled
summary: Bang Seman, a pious man, was confronted with his dark secret when his daughter, Siti Azura, decided to settle down. He tried several ways and means to stop the marriage. His wife was baffled by his demeanour until Bang Seman reminded her that Siti Azura was their illegitimate child.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: A thought provoking story that revolves around a four year girl name Jaani. She is chided by her Math teacher for providing an alternate answer to an assigned question. When queried by the grandfather the school advises that student should not challenge the teaching method and simply follow what is taught to them.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Ties That Bind
summary: The author narrates the story in the eye of the protagonist Annamalai, a gardener.  As a loyal employee he develops this special bond with his boss Amabalavanar who offers to sponsor Annamalai’s son to further his education out of love.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Dreams and Choices
summary: In “My Cousin Tim”, the author depicts the dilemma of a young man Tim, who lived the life of a spendthrift and disappointed his father, and of the cousin Eddie, who grew up with him and realised the ambitions and dreams of the older generation. Eddie and Tim were brought up in a typical family with high parental expectations to follow a dictated life of which decisions were made by his parents. However, there is a critical and significant difference between them that separates them into opposing sides of the coin.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Transition
summary: “... Ratio of women to men this year is 1:15, based on ...” Toot! I immediately hit the red button on the remote control. That statistic was constantly being reiterated in the news. It seemed to mock my age and the fact that time had passed me by. I understand that I’m 43 years old and still unmarried. Is it really that peculiar? I am human too. I would also like to get married, but who would want me?
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Disebabkan sengatan lebah yang berbisa, pencerita mengalami insomnia semalaman. Kerana terdesak, dia merayu kepada langit untuk bantuan, lalu dia menyedari keindahan kegelapan malam.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2020

subject: Dreams and Choices
summary: This story is like a modern version of the Greek legend poet Orpheus and his wife Eurydice. It examines the choice Orpheus had to make about redeeming his wife’s soul when she accidentally passed away and in this comical modern version, Orpheus wondered if he did the right thing as Eurydice proved to be annoying.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Transition
summary: Perasaan yang begitu mengganggu: Ada kalanya aku tidak sabar untuk kamu membesar, dan membawa kamu ke laut, di mana kamu akan menemui berbagai keajaiban di lautan biru, agar kamu dapat memahami mengapa kapal-kapal selalu belayar ke arah air yang berombak, dan mengapa layar terbentang apabila ditiup angin, membawa kita ke hadapan. Tetapi aku juga merasakan bahawa jika masa dapat dihentikan, aku lebih suka jika kamu tidak pernah menghadapi badai atau mengalami ujian-ujian dan cubaan-cubaan hidup.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Kerbau tidak mahu dianggap sebagai pengecut, lantas dia menyahut cabaran Kura-kura untuk berlumba merentasi tujuh bukit!
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Dibesarkan oleh seorang ibu tunggal, pencerita cuba untuk memuaskan hati ibu dan isterinya. Dia mula menyedari erti sebenar ikatan seorang ibu dan anak selepas menyaksikan kelahiran anaknya sendiri.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2024

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Seorang mahasiswi bermuhasabah diri semasa mengenangkan sejarah dan nasib kaumnya. Dalam lamunannya, dia bertemu beberapa tokoh-tokoh sejarah Melayu.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2015

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Nalini is worried when she only manages to get one pot of water for the day. Today, her mother-in-law will be furious as she needs two pots of water to cook a special meal for her son. In a dilemma, she tries her best to get another pot of water but is met with mostly unsympathetic responses.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Roads Less Travelled
summary: This is a thought-provoking short story penned by the late lawyer, S. Uthuman Ghani. The protagonist was charged in court for harassing a young lady. While he felt that he was innocent, the rest of the world saw him as an insane man awaiting court sentence.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Transition
summary: Rumah ini adalah sebahagian daripada hidup dan diri saya. Saya rasa semua orang juga begitu. Ini merupakan rumah tempat anak-anak saya dibesarkan. Anak bongsu saya, lelaki dan juga perempuan telah dilahirkan di dalam rumah ini.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Seorang anak perempuan kecil, Janani, berupaya berfikir dengan cara tersendiri. Sekolahnya pula menasihatkan agar Janani tidak mencabar kaedah pengajaran, dan mengikuti setiap apa yang diajar.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2023

subject: Bridges
summary: Agus, pemuda miskin yang tidak berpelajaran tinggi, dari sebuah kampung, merasa tertekan dengan permintaan sang isteri yang berhasrat untuk merubah cara hidup mereka agar lebih moden dan mewah walaupun rumahtangga mereka dihimpit masalah kewangan.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2012

subject: Bridges
summary: Kancil, the mouse deer, drinks water from the river every day, but the river is also the home of a hungry crocodile named Sang Buaya. Find out how Kancil outsmarts the crocodile every day!
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2012

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Penulis terkenangkan kehidupan arwah ibunya semasa beliau melihat bahawa gelang jed yang ditanam bersama arwah ibunya masih utuh dan tidak luput sinarannya.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2021

subject: Transition
summary: Such troubling feelings: At times I had looked forward to your growing up, and taking you out to sea, where you could discover the wonders of the blue ocean, so you might understand why ships always sail towards choppy waters, and why sails unfurl in the wind, carrying us forward. But I also felt that if only time could come to a halt, I would rather you never have to weather the storms or experience the trials and tribulations of life.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

book_title: Singapoetry: An Anthology of Singapore Poems
subject: Singapoetry: An Anthology of Singapore Poems
summary: Selected by NLB librarians and endorsed by a selection committee chaired by Professor Edwin Thumboo, 82 poems, SIngaPoetry: An Anthology of Singapore Poems features 82 poems that highlight the experiences, places, observations and pivotal moments in the daily lives of Singaporeans. Visit www.nlb.gov.sg/readsingapore for the audio version of the anthology.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2015

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Cerita ini tentang seekor singa lapar yang sangat malas, yang telah ditipu oleh haiwan-haiwan lain ketika memburu makanan.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

book_title: Tales from East Asia/ Kisah-kisah dari Asia Timur
subject: Tales from East Asia/ Kisah-kisah dari Asia Timur
summary: Selected by the Youth Book Selection Committee, the stories reflect the social values such as being grateful, of giving and having love in our lives. Having showcased tales from other parts of the Asian continent in the previous 2 years’ publications, 2014 sees us featuring stories from East Asia. The first story, Kaza Jizo, tells of the delight and timelessness of unconditional giving. The second story, The Ungrateful Tiger, is a Korean folktale that teaches us the dire consequences of greed and ingratitude. Finally, The Weaving Maid and the Cowherd is a tale of enduring love from China.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2014

book_title: Tales from East Asia/ கிழக்கு ஆசிய பழங்கதைகள்
subject: Tales from East Asia/ கிழக்கு ஆசிய பழங்கதைகள்
summary: Selected by the Youth Book Selection Committee, the stories reflect the social values such as being grateful, of giving and having love in our lives. Having showcased tales from other parts of the Asian continent in the previous 2 years’ publications, 2014 sees us featuring stories from East Asia. The first story, Kaza Jizo, tells of the delight and timelessness of unconditional giving. The second story, The Ungrateful Tiger, is a Korean folktale that teaches us the dire consequences of greed and ingratitude. Finally, The Weaving Maid and the Cowherd is a tale of enduring love from China.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2014

book_title: Tales from East Asia/ 东亚民间故事
subject: Tales from East Asia/ 东亚民间故事
summary: Selected by the Youth Book Selection Committee, the stories reflect the social values such as being grateful, of giving and having love in our lives. Having showcased tales from other parts of the Asian continent in the previous 2 years’ publications, 2014 sees us featuring stories from East Asia. The first story, Kaza Jizo, tells of the delight and timelessness of unconditional giving. The second story, The Ungrateful Tiger, is a Korean folktale that teaches us the dire consequences of greed and ingratitude. Finally, The Weaving Maid and the Cowherd is a tale of enduring love from China.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2014

subject: Ties That Bind
summary: To Mr Li, Tanjong Rhu was a special place where he spent his childhood. Now a successful businessman in the shipping sector, he has to cope with the loss of his mother. Tanjong Rhu gives an insight into Chinese norms, values, religious beliefs and family practices as Mr Li recalls the time spent with his mother and the events that took place before her demise.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Ties That Bind
summary: A mother faces the pressure of losing control over her children when she decides to re-join the work force. After many years of building up trust and solidifying her relationship with her children, her trust is somehow challenged by hearsays from neighbours, testifying that her children are going astray, particularly in the absence of their mother. Whom should she trust? Her teenage children whom she seldom now meets or the neighbours who keeps her update of her children’s latest whereabouts?
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Ten-A-City: Stories Built to Last
summary: Ten-a-city: Stories Built to Last is an anthology containing twenty works of short fiction and four poems from local and international writers. This unique collection commemorates the 10th anniversary of the National Library Board’s Read! Singapore campaign by bringing together well-loved stories that have appeared in previous Read! Singapore anthologies. The stories celebrate our cultural and linguistic diversity, with works in English and translations of storiesoriginally written in Chinese, Malay and Tamil. Ten-a-city is an anthology that reminds us of the power and endurance of great writing – be inspired by these Stories Built to Last.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2014

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Carabao does not want to be a coward so he takes up Turtle’s challenge to race over seven hills!(Story from The Carabao Turtle Race & other classic Philippine animal folk tales)
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Bridges
summary: Have you ever wondered how the common stray cat got its stumpy tail? Find out how from this folktale that dates back to pre-colonial Singapore!
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2012

subject: Bridges
summary: This is a story about the little things in life that we often overlook due to our busy work schedules. Only when her mother is dying does the narrator decide to quit her job as a journalist and spend more time with her, learning her precious cooking recipes.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2012

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Angah is from Negeri Sembilan, a state in Malaysia which practices the matrilineal custom of ‘adat pepatih’, where family wealth is inherited by the women. Angah feels he is unfairly treated because of his family’s strict adherence to the practices of the customs. His teenage daughter pesters him to teach her how to cook lemang, but he refuses. He soon realises the importance of family and traditions through his daughter’s insistence.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Roads Less Travelled
summary: “The Mother” is a short story about the journey of a mother who persevered to uphold justice. A divorcee, she lost her only son to an accident. Determined to find the killer, she embarked on an uncharted path to seek the truth.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: The son of an American father and a Chinese mail-order bride, Jack would play with the origami animals that his mother had made when he was a child. Her magical creations are cast aside as their relationship becomes strained. When Jack finally picks up an origami animal again, he finds a message left by his mother.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Transition
summary: Govindan has passed on. He and I once worked for the same newspaper.  I was a sub-editor. He was its only photographer. We affectionately called him “the photography expert.”
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Bridges
summary: “The Stars” is a story which considers the issue of superstition. Uncle Ram, a strong believer in astrology, refuses to give up his belief even though his astrological miscalculations make a fool out of him. Is he really right in his belief?
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2012

subject: Roads Less Travelled
summary: “Three Tests” is an extract from the novel, The Legend of the Condor Heroes, written by renowned writer, Louis Cha. It tells the story of a loving couple, Guo Jing and Huang Rong, and their adventures in the martial arts world, from grim grasslands in the north to scenic islands in the south of China. In a contest of brains and brawn, Guo Jing, the innocent young man, unexpectedly won, much to the pleasure of Huang Rong. Martial arts, intrigue, a plot-within-plot and romance are entwined in this short story to make a compelling read.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: A story about a hungry but lazy lion that gets tricked by other animals while hunting for food.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: The mysterious appearance of a white elephant in the Kampong of Taman Tiga Warna’s mosque compound leaves people frightened and in shock. Not knowing if it is evil or benign, the villagers get together to decide the fate of the mysterious white elephant.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Transition
summary: For Tengku Aman, it was here in Anjung Budiman that he learned to be independent once more. Even since he was a child, he had learned to stand on his own two feet. His late mother and father had taught him to be independent. This had been their legacy to him. It was what they both would have wanted for him after their deaths, despite the 10-year gap between their passings.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: The author talks about two wooden trunk boxes passed down from his parents. They served as luggage for them in the earlier days. As time passed, the author took possession of the trunk boxes after his parents and stepmother passed away.  Memories of his family came to his mind when he examined the old trunk boxes.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Setelah kematian ayahnya yang mendadak, Jamilah terjumpa sebuah kamera video yang baru dibeli ayahnya untuk dibawa semasa menunaikan haji bersama isterinya Maimon. Sedang pasangan ibu dan anak diulit kesedihan, kamera video ini menjadi alat bagi mereka mencari ketenangan.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2017

subject: Under One Sky
summary: Sorting through Abu Bakar’s belongings after his death, his daughter Jamilah discovers a video camera – newly-bought for the Haj he was about to go on with his wife Maimon. Amidst unspoken grief and deep-seated family tensions, this video camera unexpectedly helps mother and daughter find closure after his death.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Ties That Bind
summary: Academic and novelist Assistant Professor Sun Ailing is well-known local female writer.  In the story, the young widow left Singapore for Hong Kong after the husband died in an incident.  She was torn between her newfound love and the calling of her country.  In the end, she chose the latter.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky

subject: Under One Sky
summary: கதையின் நாயகியின் கட்டை விரலை தேனீ கொட்டிவிடுகிறது. வலியை  குறைக்க அவள் முயன்றும் முடியவில்லை. விரக்தியோடு சன்னல் திரைகளை விலக்கி இறைவனிடம் உதவி கேட்பதற்கு வெளியே பார்க்கிறாள். அப்போதுதான் இரவின் அழகு அவள் கண்களுக்கு தெரிகிறது.

subject: Under One Sky
summary: கதையின் நாயகி மன வளர்ச்சி குன்றிய குழந்தையுடன் ஒற்றைப் பெற்றோராக வாழ்க்கையைத் தொடங்குகிறாள். மகனைப் பார்த்துக்கொள்வது சவாலாக அமையும் அவளுக்கு  நண்பர்கள், பணிப்பெண், அக்கம்பக்கத்து வீட்டுக்காரர்கள்  அன்பும் துணையும் கிடைக்கிறது.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2026

subject: Under One Sky
summary: அன்று நளினிக்கு  இரண்டு குடம் தண்ணீர் தேவைப்பட்டது. ஆனால் அவளால் ஒரு குடம் மட்டுமே கொண்டு வர முடிந்தது. இன்னுமொரு குடம் தண்ணீர் கொண்டு வர முயற்சி எடுக்கிறாள்.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2030

subject: Under One Sky
summary: அமெரிக்கத் தந்தைக்கும் சீன தாயாருக்கும் பிறந்த மகன் ஜாக், தாயார் செய்த காகித விலங்குகளுடன் விளையாடி வந்தார். அவர்கள் உறவு பாதிப்படைந்ததும் தாயாரின் அற்புத படைப்புகளுடன் விளையாடுவதை நிறுத்தினார்.பின்னர் மீண்டும் அந்த விளையாட்டை நினைத்த போது, தாயார் இல்லை, ஆனால் அவர் எழுதிவைத்த செய்தியைக் கண்டெடுத்தார்.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2031

book_title: காலம் கடந்து நிற்கும் படைப்பிலக்கியங்கள்: தலைமுறைகளை இணைக்கும் பாலம்
subject: காலம் கடந்து நிற்கும் படைப்பிலக்கியங்கள்: தலைமுறைகளை இணைக்கும் பாலம்
summary: “காலம் கடந்து நிற்கும் படைப்பிலக்கியங்கள்: தலைமுறைகளை இணைக்கும் பாலம்” என்கிற இப்புத்தகத்தில் உள்ளூர் மற்றும் வெளிநாட்டு எழுத்தாளர்களால் படைக்கப்பட்ட 20 சிறுகதைகளும் 4 கவிதைகளும் உள்ளன. இந்தப் படைப்பிலக்கியத் தொகுப்பு, தேசிய நூலக வாரியத்தின் “வாசிப்போம்! சிங்கப்பூர்” இயக்கத்துடைய 10-வது ஆண்டு நிறைவின் கொண்டாட்டங்களை முன்னிட்டுப் படைக்கப்பட்டுள்ளது. கடந்த வருடங்களில் படைக்கப்பட்ட திரட்டுகளிலிருந்து பலருடைய மனத்தைக் கவர்ந்த சிறுகதைகளை மீண்டும் நினைவுபடுத்தும் வகையில் அவை இப்புத்தகத்தில் அச்சடிக்கப்பட்டுள்ளன. வெவ்வேறு மொழிகளிலிருந்து மொழிபெயர்க்கப்பட்டுள்ள இக்கதைகள் கலாசாரத்தையும் மொழியையும் போற்றும் வகையில் அமைந்துள்ளன. காலம் கடந்து நிற்கும் படைப்புகள் இப்படைப்பிலக்கியத் திரட்டில் தொகுக்கப்பட்டிருக்கின்றன. ஆதலால், தலைமுறைகளை இணைக்கும் பாலமாக அமையும் இச்சுவை மிகுந்த படைப்புகளை வாசித்து மகிழுங்கள்.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2014

subject: Under One Sky
summary: சிந்திக்கவைக்கும் இந்தக் கதை 4 வயது சிறுமி ஜனனியைப் பற்றியது. கணக்கு கேள்வியில் மாற்று வழியை நாடி விடை கண்டுபிடித்ததை, கணித ஆசிரியை ஏற்றுக்கொள்ளாததை ஜனனியால் புரிந்துகொள்ள முடியவில்லை.அதைக் கேட்க பள்ளிக்குச் சென்ற தாத்தாவிடமோ பள்ளியில் கற்றுக்கொடுத்த முறைப்படியே கல்வி பயில வேண்டும் என்று சொல்லப்படுகிறது.ஜனனியின் புத்தாக்கச் சிந்தனையை தாத்தா ஏற்றுக்கொண்டாலும் பெற்றோர் ஏற்றுக்கொள்ள மறுக்கிறார்கள்.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2028

subject: Bridges
summary: நம் பிள்ளைகளின் குறைகளை மறந்து நிறைகளைப் பார்க்க வேண்டும் என்பதை கூறும் கதை.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2012

subject: Under One Sky
summary: மலாய் சமூகத்தின் நிலைமை பற்றியும் வரலாற்று சிறப்புமிக்கவர்கள் பலரைப் பற்றியும் சிந்திக்கிறார் பட்டப்படிப்பு படிக்கும் மாணவர் ஒருவர்.

subject: Under One Sky
summary: கணவரை இழந்த தாயாரால் வளர்க்கப்பட்ட மகன், தாயார் மனைவி சண்டையால் திண்டாடுகிறான். நிலைமை மோசமாக, தாயார் வீட்டை விட்டு வெளியேறுகிறார்.  பிறகு மனைவியின் பிரசவ வேதனையைப் பார்க்கும் மகன், தன் தாயாரின் அதே வேதனையை உணர்ந்து தாய் பிள்ளையின் பந்தத்தை மதிக்கிறான்.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2027

subject: Bridges
summary: இரு நண்பர்களின் நட்பை விளக்கும் கதை.

subject: Under One Sky
summary: மறைந்த தாயாரோடு புதைக்கப்பட்ட ஜேட் வளையலை எடுத்து பார்த்ததும் அவரின் நினைவுகள் திரும்பி வருகின்றன.

subject: Under One Sky
summary: பிலிப்பின்ஸ் நாட்டு பழங்கதையான இது கோழை எனக் காட்டிக்கொள்ள விரும்பாத நீர் எருமை, ஏழு மலைகளைக் கடப்பதற்கு ஆமையின் சவாலை ஏற்றுக்கொள்கிறது என்பதைப் பற்றியது.

subject: Under One Sky
summary: வியட்னாம் பழங்கதையான இது, பெருமைப்படும் புலியையும் அறிவுள்ள விவசாயியையும் பற்றியது.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: மலேசியாவில் நெகிரி செம்பிலானில் “அடாட் பொப்பாத்தே" வழக்கத்தின்படி குடும்பச்சொத்து, பெண்களுக்குச் சேரும். இந்தப் பழக்கத்தால் அதிருப்தி அடைகிறார் அங்கா. அவரின் மகள் “லேமாங்“ உணவைக் கற்றுக்கொடுக்குமாறு வலியுறுத்தியும், அங்கா மறுக்கிறார்.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2035

subject: Under One Sky
summary: அபு பக்கரின் மறைவுக்குப் பிறகு அவருடைய உடைமைகளைப் பார்க்கும் மகள் ஜமிலா, வீடியோ புகைப்படக் கருவியைக் கண்டெடுக்கிறாள்.புதியதான அது மனைவி மைமுனுடன் அவர் மேற்கொள்ளவிருந்த ஹஜ்யாத்திரைக்காக வாங்கப்பட்டது. அந்த வீடியோ புகைப்படக் கருவியே ஆழ்ந்த துயரில் இருக்கும் தாயாரையும் மகளையும் இணைக்கிறது.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2029

subject: Transition
summary: தான் வசிக்கும் வீட்டை நேசிக்கும் பெண்மணியின் கதை.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: கிராமத்தின் பள்ளிவாசலில் திடீரென்று வரும் வெள்ளை யானை அதிர்ச்சியை ஏற்படுத்தியதோடு பயத்தையும் உண்டாக்கியது. அதன் வருகை நன்மைக்கா? தீமைக்கா? என்று புரியாத கிராமவாசிகள் வெள்ளை யானையின் முடிவை நிர்ணயிக்கிறார்கள்.
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2037

subject: Bridges
summary: 老王回想多年故事，一切宛如幽梦一帘轻轻飘过，洒落一地的是抹不去的回忆和补不了的遗憾。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2012

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 娜里妮非常着急，因为她只领到一桶水。可是今天，她的家婆偏偏需要两桶水来煮一道特别的晚餐给娜里妮的丈夫。若家婆知道她只领到一桶水，肯定会暴跳如雷。娜里妮十分苦恼，她尽力去寻找另外一桶水，可是没人愿意同情她、帮助她。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 两个拥有不同信仰的人因爱结缘，他们不顾父母的反对，毅然结成良缘。他们的爱情结晶使两家人开始接受彼此。但好景不长，这孩子被诊断出患有智力障碍。丈夫责备她生了一个不正常的孩子并离开了她们。她带着孩子到新的环境，展开了新的生活。朋友、帮佣 和邻居的关爱使她的儿子能够和其他的孩子一起参与一场赛事，并最终赢得了比赛。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 小说中的两口箱子是作者的父母从中国南来新加坡时，带过来的行李。日子一天一天过去了，父母及庶母也相继过世。最后作者选择把装旧衣服的箱子占为己有，放在家里的一个阴暗角落。这两口箱子时不时地勾起他对家人的回忆。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Transition
summary: 小说中的主人翁因女儿提出要跟他乘船出海而格外高兴，后来却发现是自己一厢情愿，使得他最终觉得“这一趟，感觉特别孤单”。
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

book_title: 十年阅城记：故事永流传
subject: 十年阅城记：故事永流传
summary: 《十年阅城记：故事永流传》是一本结合本地及海外作家的作品选集，里头收录了二十篇短篇小说及两首诗。由国家图书馆管理局所举办的全国阅读活动“读吧！新加坡”将于今年欢庆十周年，而这本特辑将过去“读吧！新加坡”选集的经典作品结合在一起。它集合了中文作家的作品，以及英文、马来文及淡米尔文作家的翻译作品，反映了新加坡的多元文化及语言。《十年阅城记：故事永流传》提醒我们好的作品有着深远的影响力和历久不衰的精神。希望这些源远流传的故事可以让你有所启发。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2014

subject: Transition
summary: 一个“火箭科学家”到美国探望离了婚的女儿，结果却有了意外的发现。作者在小说中对传统的婚姻观念“千年修得同床眠”提出了有趣的观点。
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Transition
summary: 常言道：金窝银窝，不如自己的草窝。时空流转中，作者在思考，什么是家？奢华的豪宅就一定是家吗？还是子女在哪里， 哪里就是家；爱在哪里，哪里就是家？
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 父亲阿部•巴卡过世后，女儿贾蜜拉在整理他的遗物时，发现一台摄像机。原来父亲准备要和母亲麦梦到麦加去，因此买了摄像机以便记录旅程的点点滴滴。父亲去世的噩耗影响了贾蜜拉和母亲的关系，两人都把悲痛的情绪藏在心里，而摄像机后来捕捉的画面无形中化解了她们对亡生者的思念。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 作者的拇指被蜜蜂蜇，即使蜂针取出了，她却因为疼痛不已而失眠。好几次，她在夜里爬起床用尽不同的方式减轻痛楚，如用冷水冲击拇指，在伤口上涂牙膏等等。不过，疼痛的感觉依旧纠缠她。出于无奈，她打开窗户，向老天爷求助。那一刻，她才发觉黑暗的柔情和美丽。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Transition
summary: 科技日新月异，连妻子都可以由机器人充当。小说内容妙趣横生，诙谐荒诞，读了之后，令读者不禁思考人与科技的关系。
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore
author_name: 法乌扎尼•阿兹玛•毛瓦伊

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 杰克的父亲是美国人，而母亲是父亲从一本册子挑中的。小时候，杰克总是玩母亲亲手做的动物折纸。两人的关系后来起了隔阂，杰克就再也没有碰母亲的折纸杰作。直到母亲去世的两年后，他偶然捡起地上的一只纸老虎，他才发现母亲所留下的遗言。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Transition
summary: 这是一篇怀旧的小说。一家小小的淡米尔文报馆，几名平凡的员工，守着一份发行量不大的淡米尔文报章。时间冲淡一切往日的抱负与雄心，冲不淡的只有人与人之间那份真挚情感。
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Transition
summary: 这是一篇想象力丰富，以超现实手法完成的小说。简单一道门，就可以穿越时空，或回到过去，后到达未来。其中有没有遗憾呢， 读完故事就知道答案了。
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore

subject: Bridges
summary: 作者回到她的家乡-- 中国的北方，记录了这一趟旅程的每一个感动。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2012

subject: Bridges
summary: 故事讲述了人类与人猿之间的纷争。人类为了开发土地，侵入了人猿的地盘，引发了与它们的对峙。这场对峙又是如何化解的呢？
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2012

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 回教堂附近出现了一只神秘的白象，众人胆战心惊，仓皇逃跑。由于不知道白象是好还是坏，村民们聚集在一起决定神秘白象的命运。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 安加来自马来西亚的森美兰州，在那非常讲究母系习俗的村子里，家业和财产都由女性继承。安加认为传统的母系习俗是个枷锁，让他受到不公平、不平等的对待。女儿要他传授煮竹筒饭的方法，但他始终不肯。在女儿的坚持下，安加很快地发现家庭和传统习俗的重要性。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 由守寡的母亲一手带大，主人翁成了婆媳战争的夹心饼干。婆媳之间闹得不可开交，母亲毅然离家出走，使儿子成了千古罪人。主人翁目击了儿子的出生后，终于了解母子间的联系。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 这是个越南寓言故事-- 一只骄傲的老虎遇见了一位聪明的农夫后所发生的事。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013
author_name: 故事复述人：罗布•克利夫兰

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 一名在籍国大学生思考马来族从古至今的遭遇、历史和命运，同时在冥想中和一些马来历史人物相遇对谈。这篇小说能激发读者对马来族在社会上的需求和经历的反思。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 四岁的贾娜妮为一道数学题提供了不一样的解答，虽然取得正确的答案，却被数学老师责备。贾娜妮的外公感到莫名其妙，便到学校询问。没想到学校的回应竟是：学生必须遵照老师的教学方式，不应该挑战老师的教学方法。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 作者和侄儿请挖墓人挖掘母亲的尸骨，以便拿去火化。青翠的手镯是母亲的陪葬物，一直都带在她的手腕上。不可思议的是，玉镯即使埋在潮湿的泥土底下好几年，依然明亮，光滑。作者看到玉镯，不禁想起了和母亲共处的美好时光。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 这个故事里的狮子虽然感到很饥饿，但是却很懒惰。它在觅食时，掉入其他动物设下的骗局。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013
author_name: 故事复述人：吉塔•沃尔夫

subject: Under One Sky
summary: 一只不愿被看作胆小鬼的水牛毅然接受乌龟的挑战，看谁能先跨过七座山抵达终点。
copyright: All rights reserved.  National Library Board Singapore 2013
author_name: 故事复述人：西尔维娅•门德斯•文图拉

subject: Ties That Bind
summary: With strong emphasis on metaphors, the beauty of this short story lies in the symbolic comparison between an old tree with an old man. Ideally to be chopped off and discarded, the old tree symbolizes the strength of the main character, Haji Bakri, who shares strong sentiments with the nostalgic events associated with the growth of this tree. Planted when Haji Bakri was eight years old, he and the old tree had seen many changes associated with the development of his neighbourhood.
copyright: All Rights Reserved. National Library Board Singapore
